question: A block of certain mass is placed on a rough inclined plane. The angle between the plane and the horizontal is <katex>$30^{\circ}$</katex>. The coefficients of static and kinetic frictions between the block and the inclined plane are 0.6 and 0.5 respectively. Then the magnitude of the acceleration of the block is [Take <katex>$g=10~ms^{-2}$</katex>]
explanation: Since <katex>$\mu_s > \tan(30^\circ) (0.577)$</katex>, the block moves? Wait, <katex>$\tan 30 = 0.577$</katex>. <katex>$\mu_s = 0.6$</katex>. Friction can hold it? Actually, <katex>$\tan\theta < \mu_s$</katex> implies no sliding if placed gently. But if it is sliding (implied by asking acceleration with <katex>$\mu_k$</katex> given?), or maybe it is released?
